subject: Re: [junit] Question about changing the name of tests
msgSnippet: ... Exactly how does that help Mike write a data-driven test? That seems to force each test to be a different method, which defeats the purpose of a
messageBody:
Shay Thompson wrote:

> Change the method names to something like testWhatever() where
> 'Whatever' is a different name for each test.
>
> testMyStringStuff()
> testMyBooleanStuff()
> etc..

Exactly how does that help Mike write a data-driven test? That seems to
force each test to be a different method, which defeats the purpose of a
data-driven test.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.ca
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
